title: Developers race for Melbourne's Treasury Square
text:
The project will further develop the heart of the country's fastest-growing city as the site - which spans the area between Exhibition and Flinders streets, and Wellington Parade South - could create a future link between Spring Street and the city's parliamentary precinct to the MCG and Melbourne Park sporting precinct.

It could even link to a future Federation Square East redevelopment.

"It’s the jewel in the crown," said one person associated with a bid. "Everyone is going for it."

ISPT has paired with builders Probuild and Laing O'Rourke, engineering firm Aecom and Hassell architects; John Holland and Dexus are leading a bid team that includes engineers NDY and architects Bates Smart.

A Brookfield-led team has builder Multiplex, engineers Aurecon and design firm Architectus; Cbus Property's team includes engineers Arup and architects Woods Bagot; Lendlease has paired up with John Wardle Architects.

Local player Investa is expected to team up with Canada's Oxford Properties, which took over a listed Investa-run fund last year.

Fund manager Charter Hall, which has a growing portfolio of Melbourne developments, is also interested, along with diversified developer Mirvac.

Advertisement

The bidding process requires initial expressions of interest by early November in a process run by Colliers International and EY. A likely short list of five bidders will be selected in January and they will have to produce final bids in February.

A contract is due to be signed before the end of the financial year.

Bidders say they are being asked to prepare tenders based on two prices - one for taking the risk of moving the transport and utility infrastructure associated with the site, and another on the basis of state government taking that risk.

Overshadowing requirements for the Birrarung Marr public park on the banks of the Yarra river could influence the size of any project. While some bidders say the overshadowing constraints limit the size of the three possible towers to between 15 and 22 storeys, others say the overshadowing requirements aren't mandatory.

"It's a discretionary thing; you might get more,'' one person said.
description: At a time of few sites and plentiful capital, surplus railway land offers a lucrative development opportunity.
